intro: Atractylis purpurea, commonly known as purple marsh orchid, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features tall, slender stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height, often with a reddish or purplish tinge. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in clusters, typically in shades of pink or purple, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Atractylis purpurea thrives in wet or marshy environments, making it a characteristic species of wetland habitats.
